Our rankings, ratings, and product reviews are unbiased. We do not rank or rate products or services based on our financial relationships with the companies that produce them. Our in-house research team collects extensive information used in our evaluation process, although we may not cover all options available in the marketplace. See our full methodology.

Key Takeaways

  • Progressive’s sample rates are cheaper than average in most driver categories.
  • Offers many car insurance discounts, including auto-pay, multi-car, safe driver, and paperless.
  • Optional coverage options include a deductible savings bank, which reduces your deductible by $50 for each 6 months that you remain claim-free.

    Progressive is No. 5 in our rating of the best car insurance companies with a score of 4.4 out of 5.0. To score the top auto insurers in the U.S., we analyzed average costs, feedback from a consumer survey, optional coverage, discount offerings, and other data.

    Progressive offers both home and auto insurance, which allows customers to bundle their coverage for a lower rate, but it only underwrites homeowners insurance in a handful of states. Customers in states where Progressive doesn’t underwrite homeowners insurance can still bundle their insurance coverage, but their policy will be underwritten by a third-party company.

    - Rachael Bennan, Licensed Insurance Agent and U.S. News Car Insurance Reporter

    Progressive received positive survey feedback for claims handling, and most respondents were either somewhat satisfied or completely satisfied with its customer service. In regard to the claim process, one survey respondent remarked, “They resolved the claim in a timely manner,” while another stated, “I was kept well informed of the status of my claim.”

    We also reviewed NAIC Complaint Index scores for companies in our rating, and found that Progressive has a lower-than-average number of complaints.

    The insurer’s offerings include standard coverage such as liability (bodily injury and property damage), collision, and comprehensive. It also has optional add-ons like roadside assistance, rental car reimbursement, and accident forgiveness. Plus, Progressive has a usage-based program, Snapshot, that can personalize your rate based on your driving habits.

    Today, the Ohio-based insurer sells car insurance to customers in all 50 states and Washington, D.C. You can purchase a Progressive policy online, by phone, or through an agent.

    Insights from our consumer survey

    One key component of our rating is a survey of consumers. We asked participants about their experiences with their car insurance provider, covering different areas of customer satisfaction, such as customer service and claims. Here’s a sampling of what we learned about Progressive:

    Forty-six percent of Progressive customers in our survey described themselves as completely satisfied with the ease of contacting customer service, while 29% said they were somewhat satisfied. In terms of the customer service provided, 52% were completely satisfied and 21% were somewhat satisfied.

    When asked about their level of satisfaction with the ease of filing a claim, 81% of survey participants said they were completely satisfied. The same percentage expressed complete satisfaction with how their claim was resolved.

    Eighty-five percent of Progressive customers in our survey said they were either “likely” or “very likely” to recommend the company to someone shopping for car insurance. Asked how likely they were to renew their Progressive car insurance, 87% answered either “likely” or “very likely.”

    Progressive’s average annual rate of $1,820 is $192 less than the national average rate for a year-long policy. In most driver categories we analyzed (e.g., young adult drivers, drivers with a speeding ticket) Progressive’s average rates are lower than the national average.

    Like most auto insurers, it offers discounts that can help lower your costs if you qualify. Progressive has more discounts than most insurers in our rating, including those that can reduce young driver premiums: a teen driver discount, a good student discount, and a distant student discount.

    Our review uses sample rates for comparison, but car insurance costs are based on many factors, including your location, coverage selections, and vehicle. Your actual costs will likely differ.

    Progressive’s sample annual premiums for teenage drivers are higher than the national average: $2,569 more for females and $2,558 more for males. Insurers typically view teenagers as a higher risk to insure than older motorists. That’s because teenagers lack driving experience and are more likely to be involved in an accident.

    Among age groups in our rate study, average rates for teen drivers are the most expensive.

    Car insurance costs usually go down as drivers get older, provided they maintain a clean record. Average rates for young adults – single 25-year-olds in our analysis – are far lower than for teen drivers. Progressive’s average rates are less than the national average for young adult drivers.

    The fewer miles you drive, the less likely you are to be in an accident, making you less risky to insure. On average, low-mileage drivers pay a little less for coverage than high-mileage drivers, according to our research. Progressive’s average annual rate for the low-mileage drivers in our study – those who drive 7,000 miles annually – is $187 cheaper than the national average.

    The national average rate for a driver with a speeding ticket is $559 higher per year than for a driver with a spotless record. Progressive is cheaper than average in this category. Its sample premium for a driver with a single speeding ticket is $147 lower than the national average rate.

    An at-fault accident can cause car insurance premiums to go up by hundreds of dollars per year, according to our research. For drivers with a single at-fault accident on their record, Progressive’s sample annual rate of $2,787 is $104 cheaper than the national average.

    A driver with a DUI pays an average of $1,725 more per year for coverage than a driver with a clean driving record, according to our data. In this category, Progressive has one of the lowest average annual rates in our analysis at $2,280. That’s $1,457 less than the national average for a driver with a DUI.

    In general, drivers with poor credit pay more for auto coverage than drivers with good credit. How you manage your credit can impact your credit-based insurance score, which includes various aspects of your credit history (e.g., payment history, length of credit history, types of credit). Your insurance score is one of many factors insurers may consider when assessing risk.

    For drivers with poor credit, Progressive’s sample rate is more than $900 per year cheaper than the national average.

    Most states require a minimum amount of car insurance to drive legally. The minimum typically includes liability coverage, plus some additional requirements – it varies by state. Our research found that on average, minimum coverage costs $780 per year. Progressive’s average rate of $771 is just below the national average.

    Meeting minimum requirements is just one consideration when buying car insurance. You should give careful thought to how much coverage you need for adequate financial protection.

    Minimum Coverage

    $771

    Progressive

    $780

    National Average

    In general, full coverage car insurance combines your state’s required coverage with collision and comprehensive, which are often a requirement by your loan or lease agreement. Progressive’s sample premium for this level of coverage is about $150 per year cheaper than the national average.

    Full Coverage

    $2,233

    Progressive

    $2,386

    National Average

    Minimum coverage refers to state minimum liability requirements and other state-mandated coverage. Full coverage refers to $100,000/$300,000 bodily injury liability; $100,000 property damage liability; comprehensive and collision ($500 deductible); $100,000/$300,000 uninsured/underinsured motorist (UIM); and state-mandated coverage.

    Some states don’t allow gender to be considered in setting car insurance rates, and some states restrict the use of credit-related information in determining what drivers pay for a policy.

    Progressive offers a number of discounts that can help you save on your premium if you qualify. Its discounts include:

    • Multi-policy
    • Multi-car
    • Continuous insurance 
    • Snapshot: safe driver

    • Distant student
    • Homeowner

    • Sign online

    • Pay in full
    • Automatic payment

    Progressive offers the standard coverages you’d expect from a major auto insurer, including the liability protection most states require. Its coverages include:

    Liability insurance covers injuries you cause to others in an accident, and damage you cause to someone else’s property.

    This provides financial protection when you’re in an accident caused by an uninsured motorist, or a driver who doesn’t have enough insurance.

    Collision coverage pays to repair or replace your car if you collide with another vehicle or an object, like a tree or guardrail.

    Comprehensive covers non-collision damage, such as vandalism, theft, cracked windshields, and damage caused by falling objects or severe weather.

    MedPay covers medical expenses for you and your passengers, regardless of fault.

    PIP also covers medical costs for you and your passengers, as well as lost wages and some other expenses.

    Additional coverage from Progressive

    The company also has an array of additional coverages that can help with expenses in specific situations. These include:

    • Loan/lease payoff: If your vehicle is totaled or stolen, this covers the difference between what it’s actually worth and what you owe on a loan or lease (up to 25% of actual cash value).
    • Rental car reimbursement: This covers the cost of a rental car while your vehicle’s in the shop for covered repairs.
    • Roadside assistance: This covers towing, flat-tire changes, fuel delivery, lock-out assistance, and other services.
    • Custom parts and equipment value: This can pay to repair or replace items added to modify your vehicle (e.g., a stereo, custom wheels). It usually has a $5,000 limit.
    • Rideshare coverage: This protects rideshare drivers when they’re logged into a ridesharing app (or delivery service platform) while awaiting a trip or delivery request.
    • Deductible savings bank: This add-on can subtract $50 from your collision or comprehensive deductible for each six-month period without a claim or violation.
    • Pet injury coverage: If your pet is injured while riding in your vehicle with you, this can cover up to $1,000 of their vet bills. It’s included automatically with collision coverage.

    Our rate study found that American National has the lowest average rate overall at $970 per year. That’s less than half the national average rate of $2,012.
